abstract.text: Apply textures to the surface of your scene’s 3D objects to give each object a unique appearance.

inlineContent.text: Materials define the appearance of 3D models in RealityKit, by defining how their surfaces interact with light. Materials can also occlude objects behind them, hold shaders, or act as portals to view other worlds with
RealityKit includes a few material types to help you get started, including
for basic color and textures, and
for realistic lighting effects such as reflections, roughness, and emission.

abstract.text: The parameter type that custom materials uses for properties the
framework passes to shader functions.

framework passes to shader functions.

The object type that custom material use to hold UV texture coordinates.

coating.
Create personalized and realistic spatial audio experiences.
A set of types that material parameters can use.
A container for texture data allowing you to create and update textures using your own format.

coating scatters light to create soft highlights.
An object that defines the degree to which an entity reflects light to
create stretched or oblong highlights.
Use windows, volumes, and immersive spaces to teach people about the Earth.

objects.
